column4: I used YUMI to install Ubunut 12.04 to a USB key. Is there any way I can download files to the same USB key please? Thank you!

it should be formated to fat32 normally. you can still use any space on it to save things. unless the installer made a persistant home/save file. then it should let you save to it also under the ubuntu os.
mounted how exactly? can root write to it?
use sudo to see if root can write to it....
what is the command i should use please?
perhaps 'sudo touch /whatever/the/path/is/to/the/usb/testfile'
did that mate and nothing happened?
look on the flash and see if the file is there..
It's not there!
what was the exact command you used?
sudo touch /cdrom/download
its very possible that /cdrom/ is mounted read only. the mount command may show you.
Can you tell me the full mount command please? I'm sorry I'm a complete Linux noob!
just 'mount' shows whats mounted where
/dev/sdb1 on /cdrom type vfat (rw,relatime,fmask=0022,dmask=0022,codepage=cp437,iocharset=iso8859-1,shortname=mixed,errors=remount-ro)
so do a 'cd /cdrom' and see what files are therel. see if you can make a file. it seems to be mounted RW.
it says "permission denied"
Don't give up on me mate!!! :)
remount it with the correct options would be my suggestion.
you did try makign the file as root? or a user?
as a user
so try as root with sudo again...
